text: hey guys it's angel today I have a very
special recipe for you because one of
the ingredients is from Taiwan in
today's recipe I'm going to show you how
to make I you jelly which is a
traditional Taiwanese dessert and it's
one of my favourite desserts in the
summertime because it's super refreshing
now if you haven't heard of iU jelly
before it's actually an all-natural
jelly made from a special fig tree seed
indigenous to taiwan so it's definitely
super special and if you guys are
wondering I got these from the day
market so if you guys are passing by
Taiwan and you want to head over there
to check it out I'll leave the address
in the video description so with that
let's get started with the ingredients
we're going to need one whole dried fig
fruit and we're going to remove the
seeds from those I've gone ahead to do
that earlier where I've just taken the
back of a metal spoon and gently rub
those feeds off with the spoon and my
hands next sits through a sieve to
separate the seeds from the pieces of
reddish fuzz now if you're buying
pre-made packets of seeds you won't need
to do this step otherwise prepare a
medium sized mesh bag or cheesecloth and
place only the seeds inside the bag and
seal the top this bag of seeds is going
to be super important in this recipe
will also need 5 cups of spring water or
you could use tap water
just make sure that it's not distilled
or filtered water because you do need
the minerals in there the minerals are
going to interact with the seeds and
start to coagulate and make that jelly
today I'm going to use Fiji water
because it still has the natural
minerals in here you'll also want to set
aside 2 to 3 limes
some sweetener like a honey or organic
cane sugar now comes the fun part take
your bag of seeds and with clean hands
gently rub them together within a few
minutes the seeds will start to release
a slimy substance after about 5 to 10
minutes you should notice the water
beginning to turn a light yellow color
you'll know when you're done when the
seeds change texture and feel a bit dry
at this point remove the bag and if you
notice any residual red fuzz you have
the option to remove them with a
strainer but just make sure to do so
quickly before the jelly starts to set
once you're done let the bowl sit on the
counter or in your fridge for about 30
minutes while we're waiting for the
jelly to set let's make our lime syrup
bring 2 cups of water to a boil add half
a cup of your favorite sweetener cane
sugar or honey will both work but today
I'm using coconut sugar because I have
some on hand
once the sweeteners dissolve set the
liquid aside to cool and prepare the
juice of two fresh limes you can also
use lemons but I really like the
refreshing tart taste of limes in this
recipe finally combine the juice with
the sugar mixture
next back to the jelly after about 30
minutes your jelly should have set just
check to make sure by tapping or
swirling the bowl around then with a
knife run it through the jelly in a
crisscross pattern to break them into
larger bite size cute
next pour in some of your cold lime
syrup add a handful of ice cubes and
maybe a few slices of lime on top for
presentation points then voila we have
fresh are you jelly ready to be served
chilled in bowls now the one thing to
keep in mind is that the jelly should be
stored in the refrigerator and consumed
within a day or two and the reason why
is because after day or two it'll start
to go back and return to its liquid form
so it's best to consume the day up in
addition to serving this in a bowl you
can also turn this into a drink by
making more of the sweetened lime liquid
and adding it into a cup complete with
your own bubble tea straw I'm angel I
hope you enjoyed today's Taiwanese
dessert recipe and if you haven't
already please subscribe to my channel
you can do that right here and I will
see you guys soon
bye
